      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • question1

        public static int question1​(java.lang.String queryString,
                            java.lang.String bigString,
                            int i,
                            int indexQuery,
                            int indexBig,
                            int occurence)
        reccurence function to find the index value of the i'th occurence of the query string in the given big string
        Parameters:
        queryString - the string that is been search in the big string
        bigString - the string that is been search for to query string in it
        i - value that determines how many times the query string needs to be found in big string
        indexQuery - keeps index of the query string
        indexBig - keeps index of the big string
        occurence - keeps the number of occurence of the query string in the big string
        Returns:
        if the occurence is reach to i returns the index value of the i'th occurence else returns -1

      • question2

        public static int question2​(int[] sortedArray,
                            int bottomInt,
                            int topInt,
                            int indexBottom,
                            int indexTop)
        Parameters:
        topInt - determines the top value of the interval (excluding)
        bottomInt - determines the bottom value of the interval (excluding)
        sortedArray - given sorted array which is going to be search
        indexBottom - determines the bottom index value of the sorted array to be search
        indexTop - determines the top index value of the sorted array to be search
        Returns:
        number of values between topInt and bottomInt

      • question3

        public static int question3​(int[] unsortedArray,
                            java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> subArrays,
                            int targetValue,
                            int sumOfValues,
                            int startIndex,
                            int endIndex)
        Parameters:
        unsortedArray - given unsorted array which is going to be searched to find subarrays which sum of their items is equal to target value
        subArrays - double dimensional ArrayList which holds index values of the unsortedArray. Sum of the numbers between these numbers are equal targetValue
        targetValue - Value that is searched for
        sumOfValues - Keeps the sum of the values of the current subarray that is being searched
        startIndex - starting position of the searched subarray
        endIndex - ending position of the searched subarray
        Returns:
        returns the number of subarray which sum of their items is equal to target value
